alert.note: Alert for Grundy (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 27 at 9:55AM CST until February 27 at 10:15AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following areas, Grundy, Kane and Kendall. * WHEN...Until 145 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Roads and streets may be flooded. Slow moving or standing water may continue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 954 AM CST, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms moving through the area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Aurora, Joliet, Plainfield, Oswego, Batavia, Yorkville, Morris, Channahon, Minooka, Plano, Montgomery, North Aurora, Sugar Grove, Boulder Hill, Newark, Millbrook, Lisbon, Plattville and Bristol. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
